description: This is complete dashboard to monitor libvirt hypervisors and virtual machines

panels.title: RAM and Disk usage on vm

panels.description: Basic CPU info

matcher.options: Idle - Waiting for something to happen

panels.title: CPU load on physical host

panels.description: The amount of memory in percent, that used by domain.
panels.title: Used percent

panels.description: The total amount of usable memory as seen by the domain. This value may be less than the amount of memory assigned to the domain if a balloon driver is in use or if the guest OS does not initialize all assigned pages. This value is expressed in kB.
panels.title: Total memory inside vm

panels.description: How much the balloon can be inflated without pushing the guest system to swap, corresponds to 'Available' in /proc/meminfo
panels.title: Available memory inside vm

panels.description: The amount of memory left completely unused by the system. Memory that is available but used for reclaimable caches should NOT be reported as free. This value is expressed in kB.
panels.title: Completely unused memory

panels.description: Current balloon value (in KB).
panels.title: Current balloon value

panels.description: The amount of memory, that can be quickly reclaimed without additional I/O (in kB).Typically these pages are used for caching files from disk.
panels.title: Cache

panels.description: Page faults occur when a process makes a valid access to virtual memory that is not available. When servicing the page fault, if disk IO is required, it is considered a major fault.
panels.title: Major fault

panels.description: Page faults occur when a process makes a valid access to virtual memory that is not available. When servicing the page not fault, if disk IO is required, it is considered a minor fault.
panels.title: Minor fault

panels.description: Resident Set Size of the process running the domain. This value is in kB
panels.title: RSS

panels.description: Number of bytes transmitted on a network interface, in bytes.
panels.title: Network traffic

panels.description: Number of packets received on a network interface.
panels.title: Network Packets

panels.description: Number of packet transmit drops on a network interface.
panels.title: Network drops

panels.description: Number of packet receive errors on a network interface.
panels.title: Network Errors

panels.description: Number of write requests to a block device.
panels.title: Write and read requests

panels.description: Total time (ns) spent on writes on a block device, in ns, that is, 1/1,000,000,000 of a second, or 109 seconds.
panels.title: Write and read time

panels.description: Number of bytes written to a block device, in bytes.
panels.title: Write and read bytes

panels.description: Total flush requests from a block device.
panels.title: Flush requests

panels.description: Physical size in bytes of the container of the backing image.
panels.title: Physical size of image

panels.description: Total time (ns) spent on cache flushing to a block device, in ns, that is, 1/1,000,000,000 of a second, or 109 seconds.
panels.title: Flush time

panels.description: Offset of the highest written sector on a block device.
panels.title: Image allocation

panels.description: Logical size in bytes of the block device	backing image.
panels.title: Logical size of the block device

title: Centralised Node Monitoring-Project Based usage
